Policy: Land Code (No.185 of 2001).
Policy_Content: Land Code defines the basic directions of State regulatory system improvement concerning land relations, development of various organizational and legal forms of land economy, fertility of land, improvement of land use efficiency, protection and improvement of the environment – favourable for human life and health, and the legal framework concerning the protection of the land rights. Ownership, use and disposition of land must not damage the environment, security and defensibility of the State; must not violate rights and legally defined interests of citizens and other entities. The Law consists of 24 Sections that contain 119 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 6-8) classifies land by categories. Section 3 (art. 9) deals with agricultural land. Section 4 (arts. 10-12) deals with residential land. Section 5 (art. 13) deals with subsoil. Section 6 (arts. 14-18) deals with lands of energy, communication, transport and public infrastructure facilities. Section 7 (arts. 19-23) deals with land of protected areas. Section 8 (art. 24) deals with special purpose land. Section 9 (arts. 25-27) deals with forested, water and reserved land. Section 10 (arts. 28-35) deals with management of land resources. Section 11 (arts. 36-38) deals with protection of land. Section 12 (arts. 39-43) establishes control over the implementation of the land code, deals with land use and protection. Section 13 (arts. 44-54) establishes the rights of citizens and legal entities to land. Section 14 (arts. 55-60) regards land property of citizens and legal entities. Section 15 (arts. 61-74) deals with alienation of state and community land. Section 16 (arts. 75-83) concerns allocation of land areas in tenancy from the stock of public and community land. Section 17 (arts. 84-90) concerns land turnover. Section 18 (arts. 91-97) concerns the particulars of turnover of agricultural land. Section 19 (arts. 98-99) establishes the modalities of reimbursement of agricultural and forest economy losses in the process of expropriation of land. Section 20 (arts. 100-108) deals with termination and restriction of land rights. Section 21 (arts. 109-112) establishes rights and liability of landowners and tenants. Section 22 (arts. 113-114) regards dispute settlement. Section 23 (arts. 115-116) establishes liability for the violation of land legislation. Section 24 (arts. 117-119) lays down conclusive and transitional provisions.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regulation No. 290 of 2001 establishing criteria for requesting a special permit (licence) or permit for activities with sources of ionising radiation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the criteria that shall be observed when requesting a special permit (licence) or a permit for activities with sources of ionising radiation. Citizens or permanent residents of the Republic of Latvia may request a permit for activities with sources of ionising radiation. A special permit (licence) for activities related to the utilisation of government facilities of ionising radiation, or for carrying out significant changes, may be requested by an undertaking (company) registered in the Enterprise Register of the Republic of Latvia. Foreign legal persons and natural persons registered in foreign states, or international organizations registered in foreign states may request: 1. a permit for temporary importation of sources of ionising radiation for demonstration, calibration, testing, or other similar purposes if the duration of such presence of sources of ionising radiation in Latvia does not exceed 30 days and the applicant for the permit already has a special permit (licence) or a permit for the performance of activities with the imported sources of ionising radiation in the relevant foreign state; and 2. a permit for each separate batch of sources of ionising radiation in transit. A special permit (licence) for storage of radioactive waste until the disposal thereof if the intended period of storage exceeds three years, as well as for the disposal of radioactive waste, may be requested by undertakings (companies) registered in the Enterprise Register of the Republic of Latvia, the activities of which undertakings specified in the articles of association are the disposal and management of radioactive waste (management, pre-treatment, treatment, preparation for long-term storage or disposal, and storage of radioactive waste).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Regulation enters into force on 7 July 2001.

Policy: Loi n° 01-10 portant loi minière.
Policy_Content: Les dispositions de la présente loi s'appliquent aux activités d'infrastructure géologique, de recherche et d'exploitation des substances minérales ou fossiles visées à l'article 2, à l'exception des eaux, des gisements d'hydrocarbures liquides ou gazeux et des schistes combustibles pétrolifères, qui sont soumis aux dispositions législatives qui leur sont spécifiques, mais qui demeurent, néanmoins, soumis à l'obligation de dépôt légal prévu aux articles 35 et 36 de la présente loi. Les substances minérales ou fossiles découvertes ou non découvertes, situées dans l'espace terrestre du sol et du sous-sol ou dans les espaces maritimes relevant de la souveraineté de l'Etat Algérien ou de la juridiction algérienne sont propriété publique. L'exercice des activités minières est accessible à tout opérateur, sans distinction de statut ou de nationalité, ayant obtenu un titre minier ou une autorisation de ramassage ou une autorisation d’exploitation des carrières ou sablières. L'inventaire minéral consiste à réaliser un enregistrement descriptif et estimatif des éléments constitutifs du patrimoine minéral, à l'effet de connaître les ressources minérales du pays. Le dépôt légal, est la conservation du patrimoine des connaissances géologiques nationales. Il s'agit d'un patrimoine documentaire qui rassemble les résultats de travaux et études réalisées dans le cadre d'activités attachées aux sciences de la terre, à la recherche et à l'exploitation minières sur l'ensemble du territoire national.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Regulation  No. 288 regarding activities with sources of ionising radiation for which a special permit (licence) or permit is not required.
Policy_Content: These Regulations determine cases where activities with sources of ionising radiation a special permit (licence) or a permit is not required, because it is not possible to influence such activities by human actions or the potential dose of ionising radiation and the harmful effects of the radiation are so small that from the viewpoint of radiation safety it need not be taken into account. A special permit (licence) or a permit is not required for activities with sources of ionising radiation if in the process of the utilisation of radioactive substances, one of the following conditions shall be observed: 1) the total radioactivity of the relevant radio-nuclide does not exceed the level specified in Annex 1 of these Regulations; 2) the specific radioactivity per unit weight of the relevant radio-nuclide does not exceed the limit value specified in Annex 1 of these Regulations if the total amount of the radioactive substance does not exceed 1 000 kg. In utilising natural radioactive materials, the condition shall be observed that during performance of activities with such materials the total dose of ionising radiation received by employees does not exceed 1 mSv per year.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Plan Nacional de Respuesta ante Desastres.

Policy: Act No. 312 to amend the Fertilizing Substances Act in relation with sharpening of norms of the system regulating mineral charges and the introduction of system fertilizer sale-purchase agreements.

Policy: Regional Law No. 152-OZ-2 “On forests”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of management, protection, conservation of forest fund, afforestation and reforestation. All the forests, except for the forests of defence and urban forests, shall form forest fund (public forest). Purchase and sale, mortgage and other transactions that can entail expropriation of forest fund shall be prohibited. All the regional forest fund shall be federal property. Trees and shrubbery growing on land plots owned by citizens shall be considered their property. Citizens shall be granted the right of free stay in forests pertaining to forest fund. Forest management shall be regulated by decree of the regional administration, concession, lease and free use contract related to forest management. Timber extraction shall be authorized exclusively in accordance with felling licence.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Directive 2001/42/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the assessment of the effects of certain plans and programmes on the environment.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Directive is to provide for a high level of protection of the environment and to contribute to the integration of environmental considerations into the preparation and adoption of plans and programmes with a view to promoting sustainable development, by ensuring that, in accordance with this Directive, an environmental assessment is carried out of certain plans and programmes which are likely to have significant effects on the environment. Article 3 requires the prior performance of an environmental assessment in the implementation of plans and programmes which might have an impact on the surrounding environment as referred to in paragraphs 2 to 4 of the same article. Where an environmental assessment is required under article 3(1), an environmental report shall be prepared in compliance with article 5. The following plans and programmes are not subject to this Directive: plans and programmes the sole purpose of which is to serve national defence or civil emergency; financial or budget plans and programmes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Cultivated plants, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Law No. ZR-193 on licensing.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates activities subject to licensing. It shall not be applicable to subsoil pertaining to state property and environmental permits (licensing). The following activities shall be subject to mandatory licensing: (a) pedigree stockbreeding; (b) energy production and distribution; (c) management of nuclear materials and radioactive waste; (d) nuclear energy production; (e) processing, recycling, storage, transportation and disposal of hazardous waste; and (f) processing of foodstuffs. Licences shall be issued for each separate activity and shall be valid throughout the national territory. Licence holders shall observe ecological, hygienic, sanitary, epidemiological and fire safety requirements. Licences must contain the following data: (a) name of the licensing authority; (b) licence number; (c) date of issue; (d) name and location of natural or legal person; (e) location of the production site; (f) period of validity of licence; and (g) signature of the authorized official and seal of the licensing authority. Licences shall be classified as simple and complex. Simple licences shall be issued within three days of filing an application and shall be open-ended. Complex licences shall be issued within 30 days of filing an application and shall be open-ended if not otherwise envisaged by the law.
Subject: Livestock, Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Nuclear energy,Hazardous waste,Processing/handling,Authorization/permit,Animal production,Recycling/reuse,Waste management

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2001-06 du 27 Juin 2001 portant création de l’Agence de promotion de l’Accès Universel aux Services.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée l’Agence de Promotion de l’Accès Universel aux services Régulés et le Fonds d’Accès Universel aux Services. La stratégie d’accès universel aux services vise une généralisation progressive des services essentiels au développement économique et au bien-être social, notamment les services d’eau, d’électricité et de télécommunications. La disponibilité de ses services devra permettre aux bénéficiaires d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie, à travers la qualité de l’eau fournie, les conditions de conservation des produits de consommation, l’établissement d’un lien permanent avec leur environnement. Elle devra offrir, en outre, l’opportunité d’accéder à des services de santé et d’éducation d’une qualité meilleure ainsi que de participer à l’effort collectif de développement et de réduction de la pauvreté, à travers la possibilité de réalisation des potentiels locaux de production et l’accès aux circuits de commercialisation.

Policy: Law No. 57 on tailing dump and dumping site.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to ensure safety of environment in the process of management of tailing dumps and dumping sites. Tailing dump shall be considered facilities for storage or burial of radioactive, toxic and other waste of mining industry. Dumping site shall be considered body of rock and dradge extracted in the process of mining. Management of tailing dumps and dumping sites shall be based upon the following principles: (a) priority of the protection of human life and health, and environmental protection; (b) compensation of damages caused to human health and environment; (c) public participation; (d) use of international experience; and (e) implementation of state concepts and programmes. This Law consists of seven Section divided into 25 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) safe management of tailing dumps and dumps; (3) state registration of tailing dumps and dumps; (4) supervision over the state of tailing dumps and dumps; (5) financing; (6) liability; and (7) conclusive provisions.
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Ley de equilibrio ecológico y protección del ambiente del Estado de Quintana Roo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto propiciar el desarrollo sustentable, y regular las acciones tendentes a la preservación y restauración del equilibrio ecológico, así como las de protección del ambiente del Estado de Quintana Roo. La Ley reconoce el derecho de toda persona, dentro del territorio del Estado de Quintana Roo, a vivir en un ambiente adecuado para su desarrollo, salud y bienestar, y establece las acciones necesarias para exigir y conservar tal derecho. Asimismo define las competencias y atribuciones que corresponden al Estado y Municipios en materia ambiental, en el marco de la Ley General del Equilibrio Ecológico y la Protección al Ambiente y demás disposiciones legales aplicables a nivel federal. Se establecen disposiciones para: a) formular y regular los programas de ordenamiento ecológico; b) prevenir y controlar la contaminación del aire, agua y suelo, en el territorio del Estado; c) establecer, regular, administrar y vigilar las áreas naturales protegidas de competencia estatal, considerando en primer término la preservación y protección a la biodiversidad y el aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos naturales; d) regular y vigilar los sistemas de recolección, transporte, almacenamiento, manejo, tratamiento y disposición final de los residuos domésticos e industriales no peligrosos; e) regular el aprovechamiento y protección de los acahuales; f) establecer los mecanismos de coordinación, promoción y concertación entre autoridades estatales y municipales, entre éstas y los sectores social y privado, así como con personas y grupos sociales, en materia ambiental.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Water Pollution Rules 2001 (L.N. No. 230 of 2001).
Policy_Content: These Regulations aim at the prevention and control of inland, coastal and marine waters of Trinidad and Tobago and marine waters in general. Water pollutants specific to Trinidad and Tobago are specified in the First Schedule. A person who intends to release polluted water from a registrable facility (defined in reg. 2) shall submit a 'source application' to the Environmental Management Authority under regulation 4. A registration certificate shall be issued to the applicant under regulation 7. If notified by the Authority, persons who release water pollutants beyond the permissible level (specified in the Second Schedule), shall apply for a permit with the Authority (reg. 8). Subsequent regulations provide for application for permits, duration, conditions, transfer, variation, renewal, suspension, etc. appeal against decisions of the Authority in respect of a registration certificate or a permit may be lodged with Environmental Commission (reg. 24). The Authority shall establish and maintain a Water Polluters Register pursuant to regulation 25. (26 regulations completed by two Schedules)

Policy: Act on genetically modified organisms.
Policy_Content: The present Act is composed of eight Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Institution of the governmental administration dealing with genetically modified organisms (GMOs) (sect. 2); Contained use of GMOs (sect. 3); Deliberate release of GMOs into the environment for purposes other than turnover (sect. 4); Introducing GMOs products to turnover (sect. 5); Export and transit of GMOs products (sect. 6); Provisions on criminal and civil liability (sect. 7); Changes in valid provisions, and transitional and final provisions (sect. 8).  The Act does not apply to genetic modifications of human genome. The Minister of the Environment is designated to be the competent institution in matter of GMOs. All activities specified in Sections 3 to 6 have to be accepted by the Minister.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 915 on forest monitoring.
Policy_Content: Forest monitoring is a system of observations, assessment and forecast of the state of the public forest stock with a view of sustainable forest management, conservation, protection, reproduction of forests and improvement of the protection functions thereof. Forest monitoring shall be carried out at the national and local levels. There are the following types of forest monitoring: (a) ecological forest monitoring (related to the impact of air pollution upon forests); (b) monitoring of forest pests and diseases; (c) radiation monitoring; (d) ecological and reclamation monitoring of reclaimed forest land.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Order No. 56 of the State Committee of Forest Resources validating the Regulation on the procedure for organization of hunting grounds.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the basic standards required for scientifically based assessment and inventory of types of hunting grounds, wild fauna species, quantitative and qualitative composition thereof, development (with the consideration of natural and economic conditions) the regime of hunting economy with the definition of measures for the protection, rational use, reproduction of wild faun species subject to hunting, preservation and improvement of the condition of the land allocated for hunting grounds. The requirements of this Order are mandatory for users and managers of hunting grounds, as well as organizations performing land-use planning and maintenance of hunting grounds. The main methods of the organization of hunting grounds shall be method of typology and quality assessment (bonitation, forest inventory). Quality assessment (bonitation) of hunting ground shall be performed according to natural zones, depending on the forage base and protective qualities of the land areas.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret met en exécution l’article 178 de la loi fédérale du 29 avril 1998 sur l’agriculture permettant à l'agriculture d'assumer les multiples fonctions que lui assigne le droit fédéral. Le décret applique et complète les mesures fédérales de politique agricole et de développement rural par des mesures cantonales. Policy: Loi sur le développement rural.
Policy_Content: La présente loi réglemente le développement rural. Elle a pour objectifs: a) le renforcement de l'économie cantonale; b) la sauvegarde de la viabilité des espaces ruraux; c) l'atténuation des disparités régionales; d) le maintien d'une forte population rurale; e) la promotion d'une économie agricole efficace; f) le développement d'entreprises de type familial; g) une production saine et de qualité; h) la sauvegarde du patrimoine et la préservation de l'environnement. En outre, elle complète et met en oeuvre la législation fédérale, notamment la loi fédérale sur l'agriculture. Les objectifs de la présente loi peuvent être réalisés: a) en améliorant les bases de la production; b) en prenant des mesures en matière d'aménagement du territoire et de droit foncier rural; c) en aménageant des structures d'exploitation diverses et complémentaires; d) en encourageant la formation professionnelle; e) en encourageant les productions végétales et animales ainsi que les spécialités régionales; f) en favorisant la transformation, la mise en valeur et l'écoulement de produits du secteur primaire; g) en favorisant la diversification des productions et des activités en milieu rural. Le texte comprend 32 articles répartis en 13 sections comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Formation professionnelle agricole et en économie familiale (2); Production végétale (3); Production animale (4); Agriculture biologique (5); Aménagement du territoire (6); Améliorations structurelles (7); Améliorations structurelles (8); Conditions d'engagement dans l'agriculture (9); Conditions d'engagement dans l'agriculture (10); Dispositions particulières (11); Mesures financières (12); Voies de droit, dispositions pénales et finales(13).

Policy: Law No. IX-415 “On geodesy and cartography”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the procedure for the fulfilment of geodetic and cartographic works, the purpose of the Lithuanian spatial information infrastructure, the state georeferenced spatial data sets, the purpose of the georeference cadastre, the principles of its establishment and management, the ownership rights of geodetic and cartographic production. It is related to geodetic and cartographic works, fundamental rights and duties in geodesy and cartography. This Law establishes the requirements for the use of the Lithuanian Spatial Information Infrastructure, spatial data sets and the Lithuanian Spatial Information Portal in accordance with the legal acts of the European Union specified in the Annex to this Law. Geodetic and cartographic activities include ongoing survey and mapping work performed by state institutions, municipal and specific organizations. Public geodetic and cartographic works include: (a) formation, development, management and adjustment of the state geodetic data and information; (b) adjustment of geoid parameters; (c) aerial photography and remote scanning; (d) establishment, updating and management of state orthophotographic maps and charts; (e) creation, updating and management of georeferenced maps of 1:10 000, 1:50 000, 1: 250 000 scale; (f) compilation, updating and management of all national georeferenced spatial data sets of all scales; (g) cartography of the State border of the Republic of Lithuania; (h) creation, updating and management of state thematic maps; (i) creation, updating and management of state-level topographic maps of all scales; and (j) mapping of the boundaries of residential areas. State orthophotographic and georeferenced map of the entire territory of Lithuania shall be updated at least every 5 years. National georeferenced spatial data sets shall be constantly updated. This Law consists of IX Chapters divided into 28 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II specifies geodetic and cartographic activities. Chapter III regards administration of geodetic can cartographic activities.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulations No. 259 of 2001 regarding procedures for industrial accident risk assessment and risk reduction measures.
Policy_Content: This Regulation determines: 1. the procedures for risk assessment of such industrial accidents as are related to dangerous chemical substances and dangerous chemical products (hereinafter – dangerous substances) and which exist or may exist at one or more installations and in the infrastructure of such installations in the territory of an undertaking (company), institution or other organization; 2. industrial accident risk reduction measures; and 3. dangerous substances (depending on their quantity and the degree of danger) to which this Regulation applies. This Regulation applies to establishments where the dangerous substances referred to in Annex 1 of this Regulation, or dangerous substances belonging to the group of dangerous substances or hazard class referred to in Annex 1 of this Regulation are found or may be found or may be created as a result of uncontrolled chemical processes in quantities that are equivalent to the minimum qualifying quantities indicated in Annex 1 of this Regulation, or exceed such quantities. This Regulation does not apply to: 1. military establishments or installations in the possession of the Ministry of Defence; 2. activity with ionising radiation sources; 3. transportation of dangerous consignments outside the territory of a installation; 4. transportation of dangerous substances through pipelines; 5. surveys and extraction of mineral resources in mines, quarries or boreholes; and 6. waste landfill sites and dumps. Dangerous substances are present or may be present in establishments in the form of raw materials, products, auxiliary materials by-products, intermediate products or waste, or may be produced as a result of uncontrolled chemical processes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the 1st of July 2001.

Policy: Decree No. 8 of the State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy and Cartography validating the Regulation on construction activity by land tenants, landowners and lessees.

Policy: ACT on Regulation in Network Industries (No. 276).
Policy_Content: This Act regulates establishment, status and activities of the Regulatory Office for Network Industries, scope and conditions of state regulation in network industries and conditions of the exercise of Regulated Activities and rights and responsibilities of Entities Subject to Regulation. Network Industries  mean: (a) generation, purchase, transmission and distribution of electricity, (b) generation, purchase, transport and distribution of gas; (c) generation, purchase and distribution of heat. State Regulation in Network Industries means creation of, and support to competitive-like environment, consumer protection and protection of interests of licence holders. State Regulation in Network Industries includes granting of permits to perform Regulated Activities, decision-making on business conditions upon performing Regulated Activities, decision-making on access to networks and exercise of state surveillance of business done by Entities Subject to Regulation. Regulated Activities may only be performed based on and within the extent of a licence.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 588 of 2001 of the Ministry of Natural Resources regarding organizational matters within the system of the Ministry for the purpose of economy of energy and non-traditional sources of energy.
Policy_Content: The Minister, for the purpose of increasing the efficiency of the utilization of state property – the natural resources, ensuring the economy of the primary minerals, energetic, water and forest resources and involving non-traditional sources of energy into the energetic balance of the country, orders to set up independent division within the head office of the Ministry: Department of economy of energy and non-traditional sources of energy. The Minister orders to entitle the aforesaid Department with the following task: To ensure the complete extraction and rational utilization of primary mineral, forest and hydrological resources owing to: (a) estimates, expertise and valuation (quantitative, qualitative and chargeable) of the primary natural resources; (b) monitoring and control, including space technologies for land zoning; (c) elaboration in accordance with the established procedure of the norms and standards of the allowable losses corresponding to the international standards; (d) elaboration of the system of environmental charges, stimulating their rational utilization; (e) elaboration of the system of administrative proceedings (fines, sanctions); (f) elaboration of the complex measures for the involvement of non-traditional sources of energy into the economic activity; (g) elaboration in accordance with the established modalities of the consumption levels for the primary natural resources in order to ensure the national regime of the utilization of natural resources; (h) annual estimates of the investment capacity as regards primary and non-traditional natural resources; (i) annual projecting of the profitable section of the state budget on the basis of revenues for the utilization of natural resources.

Policy: Kanesatake Interim Land Base Governance Act (S.C. 2001, c. 8).
Policy_Content: The present Act enforces the Agreement signed on 21 December 2000 between the Mohawks of Kanesatake and Her Majesty in right of Canada respecting governance of certain lands by the Mohawks of Kanesatake and to amend an Act in consequence. In particular, section 3 establishes that the purpose of this Act is to implement the afore-mentioned Agreement and, in doing so, a) to ensure that certain lands in the Kanesatake Mohawk interim land base constitute lands reserved for the Indians within the meaning of class 24 of section 91 of the Constitution Act, 1867 but not a reserve within the meaning of the Indian Act; b) to provide a framework for the exercise of jurisdiction by the Mohawks of Kanesatake over the use and development of the lands in the Kanesatake Mohawk interim land base; and c) to establish principles to govern the harmonious use and development of Kanesatake Mohawk neighbouring lands and certain lands in the Municipality of Oka. The text consist of 24 sections.

Policy: Ley Nº 8.936 - Ley de conservación y protección de los suelos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco normativo relativo a: a) la conservación y control de la capacidad productiva de los suelos; b) la prevención de todo proceso de degradación de los suelos; c) la recuperación de los suelos degradados; y d) la promoción de la educación conservacionista del suelo. Policy: Regulation on state institution "National Park "Chavash varmane".
Policy_Content: State institution "National Park "Chavash varmane" is an environmental institution of federal significance, the territory/water area of which includes natural complexes of particular ecological, historical and aesthetic value and is destined for the use for environmental protection, scientific and cultural purposes. Territory of the national park shall pertain to federal property. Land, water, subsoil, wild flora and fauna located on the territory of the national park, are allotted thereto for use (possession) on the basis of federal legislation. Expropriation of land and other natural resources from the national park is prohibited. Land plots within the boundaries of the national park, as well as buildings located thereon, structures and premises are not subject to privatization. National park shall perform the following tasks: (a) preservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and species; (b) preservation of monuments of history, culture and other objects of cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) creating conditions for regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and implementation of scientific methods for the protection of nature and ecological education; (f) organization and conduct of environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of damaged natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the national park: (a) any activity that threatens the existence of natural complexes and taken under the protection historical and cultural sites; (b) holding mass sports and entertainment events; (c) disturbance of soil cover; (d) driving and parking of motorized vehicles, passage of livestock outside roads and waterways of general purpose and outside special places provided for such purposes; (e) geological exploration and development of mineral resources; (f) removal of objects of historical and cultural heritage; (g) damage, littering, destruction of natural objects; (h) excavation and other prospecting work, including the use of metal detectors, without the written permission of the administration of the national park; and (i) carrying out activities without a license from the national park for regulated tourism and recreation subject to licensing.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Law No. 211-II ZRK on tourism.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the legal, economic, social and organizational bases for tourism. Tourism resources shall be classified, appraised, protected and managed taking into consideration maximum allowable environmental impact, and tourism resources shall be restored in accordance with national legislation. The state shall regulate tourism through licensing, standardization and certification for the purpose of protecting the environment and cultural heritage. The relevant authorities shall establish areas in which tourism is prohibited. Tourists shall have the right to access information on natural monuments, protected areas and the state of environment, and shall have the duty to conserve the environment, natural monuments and objects of cultural heritage and to prevent environmental damage.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Décret nº 2001-514 remplaçant le titre III du décret nº 96-193 du 12 mars 1996 relatif à la certification des denrées alimentaires et des produits agricoles non alimentaires et non transformés.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret remplace le titre III du décret du 12 mars 1996, relatif à l'agrément des organismes certificateurs, chargés en application des articles L. 643-5 et L. 645-1 du Code rural de la certification des produits mentionnés à l'article 1o du présent décret. Ces organismes sont agréés par arrêté conjoint du Ministre de l'agriculture et du ministre chargé de la consommation après avis de la Commission nationale des labels et des certifications de produits agricoles et alimentaires. Ils sont agréés pour délivrer soit des labels agricoles, soit des certificats de conformité, soit des certificats du mode de production biologique, soit plusieurs de ces certifications. Ils ne peuvent être agréés qu'après avoir été accrédités, sur la base de la norme EN 45011 en vigueur à la date de l'accréditation, mentionnée respectivement aux articles 9-11, 10-3 et 14-3 des règlements du Conseil des Communautés européennes nos 2092/91, 2081/92 et 2082/92, par le Comité français d'accréditation ou par un autre organisme reconnu comme répondant à des exigences équivalentes. L'accréditation a pour objet de vérifier l'indépendance, l'impartialité et la compétence de l'organisme certificateur.

Policy: Regional Law No. 549-OD “On institution of natural park “Donskoy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for management and conservation of natural ecosystems, including natural waterbodies and landscapes. The scope of institution of natural park “Donskoy” shall be to use it for environmental, educational, scientific and research purposes. Natural park shall carry out the following functions: (a) conservation of natural environment, unique natural landscapes and complexes; (b) protection and conservation of rare and endangered plant and animal species recorded in the Red Book of the Russian Federation; (c) conservation of the objects of historical and cultural heritage; (d) recreational use of natural resources and organization of recreational tourism; and (e) restoration of damaged natural, historical and cultural complexes and objects. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of natural park: (a) any type of construction; (b) stock enhancement and repopulation of waterbodies, release and acclimatization of alien fish and animal species; (c) hunting and fisheries; (d) timber extraction; and (e) movement of means of transport not related to the functioning of natural park.

Policy: Outline for Poverty Reduction and Development of China’s Rural Areas (2001-2010).
Policy_Content: The Outline for Poverty Reduction and Development of China’s Rural Areas (2001-2010). is a guiding document of national poverty alleviation and development work for the next decade. It has been formulated to further accelerate the development of poor areas, and promote common prosperity. The Outline is a cross-sectoral document. The main objectives are: adequate food and clothing, compulsory education, basic medical care and housing will be available to all poor population; the growth rate of per capita net income of farmers in poor areas will be higher than the national average level; the indicators of basic public services will be close to the national average level; and the tendency of development gap enlargement will be reversed.

Policy: Unemployment Insurance Act (2001)
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the conditions and procedure for the grant and payment of benefits upon unemployment, lay-offs and insolvency of employers, the organisation of unemployment insurance and participation in the financing of labour market services and benefits, except unemployment allowance. This Act establishes a legal person in public law, the Estonian Unemployment Insurance Fund who shall perform the obligations arising from this Act, the Labour Market Services and Benefits Act, the Work Ability Allowance Act and other legislation. Unemployment insurance is a type of compulsory insurance the purpose of which is to provide labour market services, pay labour market benefits, except unemployment allowance, provide, upon unemployment, partial compensation for the lost income to insured persons for the time of the search for work, compensation of the expenses related to the termination of employment contracts to employees and service relationships to officials in the case of lay-offs, and the protection of the claims of the employees upon insolvency of employers.

Policy: Law No. IX-375 on genetically modified organisms.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the spheres of activity related to genetically modified organisms, the state regulation and management thereof, and also the rights and the duties of the consumers of the aforesaid organisms and products containing them. The Act consists of six Chapters divided into 16 Articles: (1) general provisions; (2) competence and functions of the state bodies; (3) regulation of the activities with the use of genetically modified products; (4) data on genetically modified organisms and products; (5) information of the public on decision-making related to genetically modified organisms; and (6) conclusive provisions. The Ministry of Environment shall be the authorized institution in the sphere of the use of genetically modified organisms with the following competence: (a) to establish the modalities of information regarding genetically modifies organisms; (b) to establish criteria risk evaluation of genetically modified organisms; (c) to issue authorization for the activities related to se of genetically modified organisms; (d) to establish compulsory labelling requirements for genetically modified organisms and products (except for foodstuffs); (e) to establish criteria for the classification of genetically modified organisms; and (f) to keep and update database on genetically modified organisms and products.

Policy: Guyana Climate Change Action Plan in response to its commitments to the UNFCCC.
Policy_Content: The Climate Change Action Plan is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The overall objective of this policy is to ensure climate change adaptation and mitigation in accordance with the UNFCCC. Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 453 regarding validation of the Regulation on licensing of geodetic and cartographic activity.
Policy_Content: This Regulation determines the modalities of licensing of geodetic and cartographic activity carried out by juridical persons or by private employers. Geodetic and cartographic activity that comprises carrying out work in accordance with the Annex to the present Regulation is subject to licensing. Federal Service of Geodesy and Cartography and its territorial branches are entitled with licensing of geodetic and cartographic activity except for licensing of geodetic and cartographic activity as part of construction activity, planning and prospecting in the process of land use planning and keeping state land cadastre that is the sphere of competence of other Federal Executive Bodies. Licence for carrying out geodetic and cartographic activity issued by licensing authority is valid on the whole territory of the Russian Federation. Exclusively juridical person or private employer that are holders of the licence can carry out the aforesaid activity. Policy: Agricultural Processing and Marketing Grants (Scotland) Regulations 2001 (S.S.I. No. 220 of 2001).
Policy_Content: These Regulations introduce measures to supplement Community legislation which provides for payment of assistance from the Guidance Section of the European Agricultural Guidance and Guarantee Fund for measures which promote rural development falling within the scope of Council Regulation 1257/1999. These Regulations establish a framework for the payment in Scotland of grants for those and related purposes towards projects associated with the processing and marketing of agricultural products. Grants under the Regulations must: (a) fulfil the requirements of, and be consistent with, the purposes of cited Community legislation; (b) where the investment or project in the Highland and Islands area, relate to the marketing of quality agricultural products and fall within any of the purposes set out in Schedule 1 to the Regulations; or (c) where the investment or project is in the Lowlands area, facilitate the improvement and rationalisation of processing and marketing of agricultural products and thereby contribute to increasing the competitiveness and added value of such products and meet or contribute to one or more of the objectives set out in Article 25.2 and the fourth indent of Article 33 of Council Regulation 1257/99 (reg. 3). Regulation 4 provides for the procedure for applications for grants.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Control of Entrepreneurial Activity (No. 921–IIS of 2001)
Policy_Content: This Law provides for control of entrepreneurial activity. Everyone has the right to freely carry out entrepreneurial activity. Entrepreneurial activity under the Constitution of Georgia may only be restricted by law. The state, a local self-government body, or other administrative body is authorised to exercise control over the activity of an entrepreneur only under the procedures determined by law. Only a controlling body may exercise control over entrepreneurial activity. If there are appropriate grounds, another state body may make a proposal to a controlling body or court to inspect entrepreneurial activity of an entrepreneur. A controlling body shall be authorised to exercise control over entrepreneurial activity (including, entering an enterprise, requesting documents, suspending its activity, sealing the property of an entrepreneur and inspecting an enterprise and the quality of the production manufactured by the entrepreneur) only by order of the judge.

Policy: Law No. 32-Z on transportation of hazardous substances.
Policy_Content: The document consists of 7 Chapters that contain 31 Articles. The present Act establishes legal, economic and organizational basis for regulation of the relations in the sphere of transportation of hazardous substances on the national territory and is aimed at rising up the safety level of transportation of hazardous substances, prevention of disasters and incidents in the process of carrying out the aforesaid activity. Objects of transportation of hazardous substances are hazardous cargo, transport means, communications, constructions, devices and other property used for transportation of hazardous substances. Transportation of hazardous substances is subject to licensing. Certification of some work and services in the sphere of transportation of hazardous substances is carried out within National certification system in conformity with legislation currently in force. Only hazardous substances listed as authorized ones shall be authorized for transportation. Hazardous substances unfit for use as a result of disasters and incidents must be collected and reclaimed.

Policy: Control of Pollution (Silage, Slurry and Agricultural Fuel Oil) (Scotland) Regulations 2001 (S.S.I. No. 206 of 2001).
Policy_Content: These Regulations require persons with custody or control of a crop being made into silage, of livestock slurry or of certain fuel oil to carry out works and take precautions and other steps for preventing pollution of inland or coastal waters. The principal changes respect to past legislation are: (a) to redefine the meaning of the term "silage" as "any forage crop which is being, or has been, conserved by fermentation or preservation (including the use of additives), or both, and which is intended for consumption by livestock"; (b) to make provision to ensure that places where silage is proposed to be stored are at least 10 metres from inland or coastal waters; (c) to allow persons making bulk bagged silage on farms to do so without restrictions where bags in which that silage is kept incorporate a facility which allows for the safe removal of excess effluent; (d) to allow for substantial reconstruction of an exempt structure with the agreement of Scottish Environmental Protection Agency ("SEPA"), where the risk of pollution will be reduced; (f) to extend the powers available to SEPA to serve notices in respect of all structures used for purposes covered by the 1991 Regulations rather than being restricted to exempt structures where there is a significant risk of pollution identified; and (g) to allow SEPA in cases where a notice requiring works is necessary to require the drawing up and implementation of a Farm Waste Management Plan in accordance with methods identified for the collection, storage and land application of slurry and manure contained within guidance currently contained within the Code of Good Practice for the Prevention of Environmental Pollution From Agricultural Activity.

Policy: Rural Land Occupiers (Protection from Eviction) Act, 2001 [Chapter 20:26].
Policy_Content: This Act declares that a person occupying rural land who, but for this Act, would be subjected to any legal proceedings for an order for the recovery of possession, shall be a protected occupier of rural land for the period referred to in subsection four, if: (a) that person was occupying the land on the fixed date and is still occupying the land at the date of commencement of this Act; and (b) that person occupied such land in anticipation of being resettled by an acquiring authority on that or any other land for agricultural purposes in terms of the Land Acquisition Act [Chapter 20:10]; and (c) that person qualifies for settlement on that or any other land in accordance with the relevant administrative criteria fixed by an acquiring authority for the resettlement of persons for agricultural purposes. Section 4 determines the period of protected occupation, whereas section 5 concerns the evidence in legal proceedings of the status of protected occupier. Section 6 states that this Act does bind the State. This means that no person shall be a protected occupier of any land held by or registered in the name of the State; or continue to be a protected occupier of land which had been subjected to an acquisition order, after the date on which the title of the State to such land is registered in terms of section 10 of the Land Acquisition Act. (6 sections)

Policy: Crofting Community Development Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2001 (S.S.I. No. 208 of 2001).
Policy_Content: These Regulations introduce measures to supplement Council Regulations (EC) No. 1257/1999, (EC) No. 1260/1999, and Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1750/1999. Measures relating to Objective 1 areas (which include the Highlands and Islands for transitional support under Objective 1) are subject to the provisions of Council Regulation 1260/1999. An eligible applicant who wishes to benefit from financial assistance must prepare a development plan which must include the information listed at regulation 4(2). Policy: Epidemic Diseases of Animal Act of 2001.
Policy_Content: This Act consisting of 14 articles and 2 Tables aims at providing for procedures to be followed in case of appearance of epizootic diseases in animals. They are (i) keep the animals affected, or suspected to be affected  secluded, from other animals; (ii) notify immediately the nearest veterinary point; (iii) prevent the slaughter or skinning of animals affected; (iv) prevent the transfer of carcasses, litter and dung without approval; (v) prevent movement of the animals from any place without approval; and (vi) burn the carcasses, litter and dung of animals affected. The Act deal also with (a) duty of local authorities (mainly to inform the competent authority); (b) duty of the competent authority (check the nature of the disease); (c) procedures for declaration of infected area; (d) procedures in the infected area (permits to transfer the animal, or part of it, outside the area, declaration of a secluded area, or areas, displacement of the animal from water sources and pastoral areas, warn owners of sound animals); (e) treatment of affected animals; and (f) ban of trading and circulation affected animals. The 2 Tables list the epizootic diseases concerning the present Act.

Policy: Decree No. 5 of the State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy and Cartography validating the Regulation on establishment and cessation of land servitude.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that land servitude shall be established for passage through adjacent, and when necessary through another land plot, laying electric power lines,  communication cable and pipelines, ensuring water supply and land reclamation, and also for other needs that cannot be ensured without the establishment of servitude. The establishment of servitude shall not entail the change of the purposeful use of land plot. Servitude shall be established and stopped by agreement between the person concerned and the owner of adjacent land plot and it shall be subject to registration. In case of lack of agreement between the person concerned and the landowners servitude shall be established by court decision. Servitude shall be established by the body of cadastral registration. The person concerned shall submit application to the body of cadastral registration containing the following documentation: (a) cadastral number and address of the dominant land plot and land plot subject to servitude; (b) personal data of the applicants; (c) the purpose of servitude; and (d) information of compensation if envisaged by the applicants. Servitude proceedings shall be completed within a month from the date of filing the application. Servitude shall be stopped by cancellation of record of state registration thereof in state cadastre register.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Law No. 60 “On sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to ensure sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population and it ensures the right of citizens to favourable environment and prevention of negative environmental impact. Sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall be ensured by: (a) state sanitary and epidemiological supervision; (b) state social and hygienic monitoring; and (c) compulsory state registration of hazardous substances and hazardous waste. Potentially hazardous chemical and biological substances shall be authorized for manufacturing, transportation, storage, trade and application exclusively after state registration. In soil of urban and rural areas, and also in agricultural land contents of hazardous substances shall comply with indices of authorized maximum allowable concentration limits.

These are capital measures by creating new or improving existing diversified agricultural activities and diversification outwith agricultural activities to provide alternative sources of income. They include support for training and marketing. Any of these measures can also be undertaken as collaborative ventures. Policy: Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP) 2003-2005.
Policy_Content: This Poverty Reduction Strategy is a nationwide sectoral document, set also by referring to the MDGs, that adopts a twin-track approach in dealing with the problem that needs to be faced together with the creation of an environment conductive for the achievement of economic growth, creation of job opportunities, better services and effective social safety for the poor. Main goal of the Strategy is, therefore, reduction of poverty by 13.1% in the three-year period considered by the document. This may be achievable through appropriate economic growth that will lead to increasing real GDP, together with effects of the population policies that seek to reduce the annual population growth. Besides the overall goal, the Strategy also seeks to achieve a number of sectoral objectives leading to overall poverty reduction, namely (i) coverage of social services, including rate of health care coverage, health facilities in the rural areas, enrollment in basic education, reduction of the gender and regional gaps; (ii) improvement of infrastructure, such as production of water for domestic use, public water networks in rural and urban areas, sewerage treatment plants, electricity coverage, road construction and maintenance; and (iii) ensuring social protection, in particular social welfare, social pensions, training and job opportunities for handicapped persons, and orphans, street children and beggars issue.

Policy: Decree No. 217 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on arrangements for protection of forests and proclamation of emergency situations in forests.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes: (a) arrangements for forest protection, the modalities and time periods for the performance thereof; and (b) the modalities of proclamation of emergency situations as a result of spreading of forest fires, pests and diseases. It shall be applicable also to protected areas. Forest trees infested by pests or infected, broken or damaged that can contribute to spreading of pests and diseases shall be subject to intermediate felling and sanitary felling. Forest cutting areas shall be cleared upon completion of felling and winter forest felling areas shall be cleared no later than 1 May of the current year. Proclamation of emergency situation in forests shall be done by State Commission on Emergency Situations upon proposal by State Forest Service.

Policy: Ley Nº 27460 - Ley de promoción y desarrollo de la acuicultura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley regula y promueve la actividad acuícola en aguas marinas, aguas continentales o utilizando aguas salobres, como fuente de alimentación, empleo e ingresos, optimizando los beneficios económicos en armonía con la preservación del ambiente y la conservación de la biodiversidad. Están comprendidos en los alcances de esta Ley las personas naturales o jurídicas que desarrollen actividades acuícolas, las cuales comprenden el cultivo de especies hidrobiológicas en forma organizada y tecnificada, en medios o ambientes seleccionados, controlados, naturales, acondicionados o artificiales, ya sea que realicen el ciclo biológico parcial o completo, en aguas marinas, continentales o salobres. La actividad acuícola comprende también la investigación y, para efectos de esta Ley, el procesamiento primario de los productos provenientes de dicha actividad. El Ministerio de Pesquería es el ente rector a nivel nacional de la actividad acuícola que promueve, norma y controla el desarrollo de la actividad en coordinación con los organismos competentes del Estado, conforme al Reglamento de la presente Ley. Se crea la Comisión Nacional de Acuicultura en el Ministerio de Pesquería, como instrumento de coordinación intersectorial de la actividad acuícola, encargado de coordinar la participación de los sectores públicos y privados en la promoción del desarrollo sostenido de la acuicultura. La Dirección correspondiente del Ministerio de Pesquería asume las funciones de secretaria técnica de la Comisión Nacional de Acuicultura, de conformidad con lo que establezca el Reglamento de la presente Ley.

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 227 laying down guidelines and modernizing the forestry sector, in accordance with article 7 of Act No. 57 of 5 March 2001.
Policy_Content: The Act makes provision aimed at promoting sylvo-culture and ensuring a rational management of national forests. Article 2 gives the definition of "forest". Within 12 months from the entry into force of this Legislative Decree, the Regions shall fix extension and width limit values. Such limit values are intended to identify those areas which fall within the definition of "forest". The Regions must elaborate and review periodically their forestry plans, which shall concern protection, improvement and development of the forestry sector, without any prejudice to the guidelines formulated by the Ministry of Agricultural and Forestry Policies and the Ministry of the Environment. Forest transformation (which means vegetation removal for destining a particular area to other uses than forestry uses) is prohibited, without any prejudice to authorizations granted by the Regions as per article 151 of Legislative Decree No. 490 of 20 October 1999. When forest transformation is allowed, it must be accompanied by afforestation policies. As referred to in article 5, the Regions shall lay down rules in order to: a) protect forest areas in case of degradation; b) regulate concession procedures concerning the management of forests that belong to public entities; c) promote the creation of forestry associations. The Regions shall as well elaborate: a) lists of enterprises operating in the forestry sector; b) registers on forests, trees and seed trees intended for the production of forestry propagating material. The regional authorities shall submit the information to the Ministry of Agricultural and Forestry Policies, which shall elaborate the National Register of Forestry Propagating Material.

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 228 laying down the guidelines and modernizing the agricultural sector, as per article 7 of Act No. 57 of 5 March 2001.
Policy_Content: The present Legislative Decree makes provision for the development and modernization of agriculture at the national level. The Decree is divided into five Parts dealing with the cooperatives, organizations, institutions and contracts related to the agricultural sector. Article 1 amends article 2135 of the Civil Code which contains the definition of agricultural entrepreneur. The latter is hereby defined as any entrepreneur who carries out the following activities: land cultivation, sylviculture, animal farming and other related activities (including the manipulation, conservation, processing, transformation and placing on the market of agricultural products). Farmers' cooperatives and consortia are included in such definition (art. 1, par. 2). Farmers registered in the Register of Enterprises are allowed to sell directly their products throughout the national territory in compliance with hygienic and sanitary provisions in force (art. 4, par. 1). Vending is permitted upon previous notification to the competent Commune (art. 4, par. 2). Part II of the Legislative Decree deals with agricultural contracts and rural districts. The provisions contained in Act No. 203 of 3 May 1982 shall apply to lands pertaining to the public domain and to lands belonging to public entities as well (art. 6). Part III regulates the relationship between farmers and the Public Administration through, on the one hand, collaboration contracts (art. 14) and, on the other hand, conventions (art. 15). The said contracts and conventions are intended to encourage the agricultural production and to protect typical organic products, without any prejudice to soil conservation and forest safeguarding. Part IV concerns the financial aid scheme to be enacted for the agro-industrial improvement, giving priority to enterprises directly managed by farmers (including cooperatives and consortia as well as recognized producers' organizations). Article 19 establishes the Interdepartmental Commission for Food Safety. Moreover, the Central Government, the Regions and the Local Entities shall protect, in accordance with their own competences: (a) typical food products, giving particular regard to agricultural and food products of controlled origin (DOC), of protected origin designation (DOP) and of controlled origin and guaranteed designation (DOCG); (b) agricultural lands where organic techniques are used; (c) zones of particular agrarian interest. Plants, seeds, fertilizers and pesticides entirely or partially consisting of genetically modified organisms shall be subject to the special monitoring system referred to in article 22. The Regional Phytosanitary Services shall contribute to inspections to be carried out on GMOs. The designations "mountain" and "mountain product" can be used only under the conditions established by Council Directive 75/268/EEC and Regulation 1257/99/EC. Article 26 regards producers' organizations, which aim at: (a) laying down production programmes; (b) promoting the marketing of partners' products; (c) restricting costs of production; (d) promoting culture practices and techniques compatible with the environment and animals' welfare. The Regions shall recognize the above-mentioned organizations under the conditions defined by articles 26 and 27.

Policy: Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance "Krasny Yar".
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that state nature reserve of federal significance "Krasny Yar" shall be classified as biological (zoological) protected area constituted for an indefinite time period. Nature reserve shall be located in the Buryatia region. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation, restoration and reproduction of wild fauna, in particular precious marketable game species, rare and endangered species; (b) conservation and protection of natural habitats of wild fauna species, migratory routes thereof; (c) scientific research; and (d) biotechnical arrangements with a view of creating favorable conditions for protected wild fauna species. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) ploughing up of the territory; (b) timber extraction without prior authorization by hunting department, procurement of soft resin, grazing of cattle, picking berries, mushrooms, edible nuts, seeds, medicinal and other plants; (c) hunting, fisheries; (d) collection of biological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (e) drainage, irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) allotment of land plots for construction, collective horticulture and gardening; (g) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (h) water logging; (i) blasting operations; (j) movement and parking of motor vehicles, vessels, flight of aircraft less than 1000 meters above the territory of the nature reserve and landing of aircraft; and (k) organization of encampments, bivouacs, tourist camps, and other forms of recreation of the population.

Policy: Order No. 475/2001 approving the Regulation for the environmental measures to be applied within Rural Development Plan - RURIS.
Policy_Content: This Order approves the Regulation for the environmental measures to be applied within the Rural Development Plan - RURIS. The Regulation consists of 8 chapters and 8 annexes establishing the financial assistance regime with the following purposes: a) promote agricultural land exploitation according to the protection and improvement of the environmental sector (including natural resources, soil and biodiversity protection); b) promote agricultural activity and the management of extensive meadows; c) natural heritage and cultivated land protection ; d) preserve nature from pollution; e) promote the use of environmental planning for agricultural exploitations. The Regulation is divided as follows: General provisions and definitions (Chap. 1); Environmental, soil and water protection and improvement (2); Natural heritage and agricultural land preservation (3); Conservation and improvement of cultivations (4); Conservation of natural ecosystems within agricultural areas (5); Protection of genetic biodiversity (6); Licensing and requirements to obtain a financial assistance (7); Final provisions (8).

Policy: Water (Prevention of Pollution) (Code of Practice) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2001 (S.S.I. No. 175 of 2001).
Policy_Content: The Supplement gives practical guidance to persons engaged in agriculture with respect to activities that may cause nitrate water pollution and seeks to promote desirable practices by such persons in this field. The Supplement forms the code of good agricultural practice for the purposes of Article 4 of Council Directive 91/676/EC concerning the protection of waters against pollution caused by nitrates from agricultural sources. The supplement also has a further purpose in relation to the requirements of Article 4 of Council Directive 91/676/EC. This Article requires Member States to establish a code of good agricultural practice to be implemented by farmers on a voluntary basis, with the aim of providing waters with a general protection against pollution. Article 5 of the Directive deals with the establishment of Action Programmes in respect of nitrate vulnerable zones. Once a nitrate vulnerable zone has been designated and Action Programme Regulations are made, measures in the code (insofar as not contained into the Action Programme Regulations) become mandatory requirements on farmers. The supplement clarifies the content of these measures. The Scottish Environment Protection Agency is required, by section 51(2) of the Control of Pollution Act 1974 to take into account whether there has been or is likely to be any contravention of an approved code of practice when considering when and how to exercise any powers which may be conferred on it by any regulations as may be made under section 31A of that Act.

Dans le but d'assurer la protection de la santé humaine, l'agence a pour mission de contribuer à assurer la sécurité sanitaire dans le domaine de l'environnement et d'évaluer les risques sanitaires liés à l'environnement. Elle a pour vocation de fournir au Gouvernement, par tout moyen, l'expertise et l'appui scientifique et technique nécessaires à l'élaboration et à la mise en oeuvre des dispositions législatives et réglementaires, y compris les mesures d'adaptation au droit applicable dans les départements d'outre-mer, des règles communautaires et des accords internationaux relevant de son domaine de compétence, et instruit, pour son compte et sous l'autorité du directeur général, les dossiers que le Gouvernement lui confie.

Policy: Arrêté Ministériel n° 2001-277 portant application de l'article 0.753-2 du Code de la Mer, relatif aux normes de qualité sanitaire des eaux de baignade
Policy_Content: Est inséré dans le Code de la Mer (troisième partie : arrêtés ministériels), au titre V, intitulé "Pratique des bains de mer et des sports nautiques", du livre VII, intitulé "La police des eaux territoriales et des eaux intérieures", un chapitre III " Qualité des eaux de baignade". Les caractéristiques microbiologiques, physiques et chimiques auxquelles doivent répondre les eaux de baignade sont précisées, sous forme de paramètres, dans les tableaux A et B figurant sous l'article A.753-5. Le tableau A contient les paramètres qui doivent obligatoirement être vérifiés lors des contrôles et des analyses visés à l'article 0.753-3, et en fonction desquels est déterminée la qualité sanitaire desdites eaux, soit ponctuellement lors de chaque analyse, soit globalement en termes de conformité pour l'ensemble de la saison balnéaire, comme prévu à l'article 0.753-5. Le tableau B précise les paramètres devant obligatoirement être vérifiés lorsque se révèle une possible détérioration de la qualité des eaux, comme prévu à l'article 0.753-4.

Policy: Regional Law No. 44-OZ “On seed growing of agricultural crops”.

Policy: Seeds and Plant Varieties (Plant Breeder's Rights) (Trees and Woody Climbers Scheme) Regulations, 2001 (Cap. 326).

Policy: Environment Protection Act.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down the general principles of environment protection in Poland, creates a framework for administration, planning and decision-making at the national level, and regulates various matters related to environment protection, in particular the principles of the establishment of: (a) the conditions for the protection of environmental resources; (b) the conditions for the release of substances or energies into the environment; (c) the costs of the use of the environment. The present Act is composed of the following sections: General provisions (sec. 1); Protection of environmental resources, i.e. air, water, land, noise pollution, electro-magnetic pollution, animals and plants (sec. 2); Pollution prevention (sec. 3); Serious breakdowns (sec. 4); Financial and legal assets (sec. 5); Liability in environment protection (sec. 6); Authorities and institutions of environment protection (sec. 7); Final provision (sec. 9). This Act establishes also an ecological policy for creating conditions required to introduce environment protection.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Airborne Contaminant Discharge Monitoring and Reporting (O. Reg. 127/01).

At the outset the Regulation contains a definition clause relating to terms employed therein, such as “discharge unit”, “facility”, “guideline”, “NAICS” (North American Industry Classification System). The Regulation applies to a facility if it is part of a class identified by a NAICS code listed in Table 1 to the Guideline. Section 6 establishes that the owner and the operator of a facility required to ensure that air emissions of a contaminant from the facility are monitored and calculated shall ensure that a report is prepared and submitted to the Director, in accordance with the related Guideline. The text consists of 14 sections.

Policy: Regional Law No. 304 “On energy saving”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal, economic and organizational grounds for state policy in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of efficiency of the use of fuel and energy. Its shall be applicable to: (a) efficient use of energy resources in the process of extraction, processing, transportation, storage and consumption; (b) state supervision over efficient management of energy resources; and (c) scientific research in the sphere of energy saving. Basic principles of regional policy in the sphere of energy saving shall include efficient use of local energy resources and use of renewable energy. Compulsory energy inspection shall be carried out in all organizations consuming over six thousand tonnes of conditional units of fuel annually with a view of efficiency assessment of the use of energy resources and cost reduction.

Policy: Regional Act No. 13 laying down new provisions on mountain areas, in implementation of Act No. 97 of 31 January 1994.
Policy_Content: In compliance with the rules and principles laid down in Act No. 97 of 1994, the present Regional Act promotes the protection, the improvement and the socio-economic development of mountain areas, which are regarded by the Friuli-Venezia Giulia Region as an important element of its own environmental, natural, cultural and socio-economic heritage. Article 2 designates the application scope of the Act, which shall apply to the territories of mountain Communes. With a view to encouraging the conservation and, when necessary, the restoration of agricultural and sylvo-pastoral resources, the Region promotes the creation of consortia by owners of lands falling within mountain areas (art. 6). Article 7 describes in detail the aims to be pursued by such consortia. Article 12 deals with development of mountain agriculture. Furthermore, mountain Communes are entitled to draw up special restoration plans devoted to abandoned lands or non cultivated lands (art. 13). Article 16 sets up the International Centre of Mountain Research.

La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, «le centre agréé», «l'organisme de contrôle agréé», «le mode de production biologique», «une exploitation agricole ou horticole», «agriculteur», «agriculteur traditionnel», «l'agriculteur traditionnel», «l'agriculteur en reconversion», «l'agriculteur biologique», etc. Le texte comprend 14 articles divisés en 6 chapitres dont les plus importants sont: Critères d'agrément d'un centre (II); L'encouragement de l'agriculture biologique par l'établissement de plans de développement d'exploitation (III); Accompagnements d'exploitations destinés aux agriculteurs en reconversion et aux agriculteurs biologiques (IV); Surveillance de la qualité et contrôle (V). Le texte comprend 14 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ley Nº 27446 - Ley del Sistema Nacional de Evaluación del Impacto Ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por finalidad: a) la creación del Sistema Nacional de Evaluación del Impacto Ambiental (SEIA), como un sistema único y coordinado de identificación, prevención, supervisión, control y corrección anticipada de los impactos ambientales negativos derivados de las acciones humanas expresadas por medio del proyecto de inversión; b) el establecimiento de un proceso uniforme que comprenda los requerimientos, etapas y alcances de las evaluaciones del impacto ambiental de proyectos de inversión; c) el establecimiento de los mecanismos que aseguren la participación ciudadana en el proceso de evaluación de impacto ambiental.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 189 regarding validation of the Regulation on the State Committee on Land Survey.
Policy_Content: State Committee on Land Survey is a state institution responsible for the state and elaboration of the common state policy in the sphere of land relations and carrying out land reform. State Committee on Land Survey is authorized to carry out its functions directly, through its local branches and land-surveyors of local self-government. The main tasks of the Committee are: 1) elaboration of common policy and realization of the decisions made in the sphere of land survey, land tenure and land relations; 2) carrying out state control over efficient use and protection of land resources in accordance with land legislation; 3) carrying out land survey, keeping land cadastre and carrying out land monitoring; 4) cadastre land valuation; 5) carrying out land reform; 6) state registration of land rights.

Policy: Décret nº 2001-359 relatif à l'attribution d'une prime annuelle destinée à compenser les pertes de revenu découlant du boisement de surfaces agricoles.
Policy_Content: Une prime annuelle par hectare, destinée à compenser les pertes de revenu découlant du boisement de surfaces agricoles, prévue à l'article 31, paragraphe 1, deuxième alinéa, deuxième tiret du règlement (CE) nº 1257/1999 du Conseil du 17 mai 1999, peut être attribuée dans les conditions fixées par le présent décret. - La prime de compensation de perte de revenu est attribuée pour les boisements réalisés sur des surfaces agricoles. Il s'agit de terres non boisées qui ont fait l'objet d'une exploitation agricole pendant au moins deux années consécutives au cours des cinq années précédant la date de demande de prime compensatrice de perte de revenu et qui figurent alors dans une des catégories suivantes : terres, prés, vergers, vignes, landes, terrains affectés à la culture maraîchère, florale, d'ornementation et pépinières. Pour bénéficier de l'aide au boisement d'une terre agricole, le projet de boisement devra respecter les conditions d'éligibilité techniques et de superficie définies par l'Etat régionalement ou par une collectivité territoriale. Le bénéficiaire de la prime s'engage en contrepartie à ce que les superficies boisées soient entretenues pendant la durée du versement de la prime, conformément au programme d'entretien et de travaux établi et signé par lui, agréé par l'administration préalablement à l'attribution de la prime.

Keyword: Agricultural land,Financial agricultural measures,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Land-use planning
